Description of incident: A woman was sentenced to 30 months in federal prison for access device fraud.  Stephanie Fahlgren was arrested in July of 2009 after it was determined that she had obtained and misused the personal and financial information of more than 114 people.  She obtained access to the New York Life Insurance Company's computer database by using the login information of a Sacramento insurance agent.  The database contained personal and medical information of prospective life insurance purchasers.  Fahlgren used the information between June and November of 2008, to open lines of credit and obtain credit cards in the names of those people.  The amount of restitution owed to the fraud victims will be determined on in July of 2010.
